item.title: Node Ordering for Rescalable Network Summarization (or, the Apparent Magic of Word Frequency and Age of Acquisition in the Lexicon)
item.description: How can we “scale down” an n-node network G to a smaller network, with k « n nodes, so that G (approximately) maintains the important structural properties of G? There is a voluminous literature on many versions of this problem if k is given in advance, but one’s tolerance for approximation (and the resulting value of k) will vary. Here, then, we formulate a “rescalable” version of this approximation task for complex networks.
